Like the way that my parents gave so much to me for 40 yrs. In bottom corner I could faintly see a piece of paper with kid‚Äôs writing. I could tell it‚Äôs from my sister as the next photo is of her lovingly watching over me. As @RepJayapal, @SenWarren, @RepChuy, and dozens of House members and Senators write, the U.S. has demonstrated its leadership and the value of this multilateral financial system. It's time to do so again.

The full letter can be found here ‚û°Ô∏è https://progressives.house.gov/_cache/files/f/3/f3aa15fe-cca2-40da-a68b-937e3d8646f9/15748EFE144F03BA67ADE35DF1A98155.7-12-22-jayapal-warren-sdr-issuance-letter.pdf

A new SDR issuance is the simplest, fastest way the U.S. can support Ukraine, neighboring allies, and impacted countries during these crises, at no cost to American taxpayers.

It's why the CPC, @CAPAC, @TheBlackCaucus, @HispanicCaucus have all advocated for SDRs in years past.

The impact of Special Drawing Rights is clear.

Last year's issuance empowered at least 99 developing countries to stabilize their currencies, shore up reserves, pay off debts, and finance health care, including vaccinations and other urgent needs.

The urgency has only increased since Russia's war on Ukraine, which has decimated the Ukrainian economy, disrupted the global food and energy supply, and pushed millions more into hunger and poverty.

Ukraine called the need for new SDRs "a question of survival for our country."

The need for these assets is critical:
‚ûñThe number of people facing food insecurity has doubled since 2019
‚ûñNearly 85% of people in low-income countries haven't received a single COVID vaccine dose
‚ûñThe developing world is facing a debt crisis and 1.7b people could be affected
